definition: pooh/pah/bah/(today used as a phonetic component in 部[bu4], 倍[bei4], 培[pei2], 剖[pou1] etc)
to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
twice the effort for half the result
doubly homesick for our dear ones at each festive day (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: mei3 feng2 jia1 jie2 bei4 si1 qin1

sentences.english: The sun is a huge blazing ball, a million times larger than the earth.
sentences.chinese: 太陽是個龐大的熾燃火球，比地球大一百多萬倍。

sentences.english: CFRP, after all, is 50 times as expensive as steel.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，碳纖維增強塑料比鋼貴50倍。

sentences.english: In the autumn, bringing a moon, I loved.
sentences.chinese: 中秋夜，皎潔的月光，讓我倍思親。

sentences.english: It can lift 10 times its bodyweight: two tons.
sentences.chinese: 它能舉起10倍於自身體重的物體。

sentences.english: They were nearly four times as likely to live long after bypass surgery as were the unmarried.
sentences.chinese: 她們搭橋手術後的存活率幾乎是未婚者的4倍。

sentences.english: Install behind, was beautiful and charming and add seductive charm.
sentences.chinese: 成裝上身後，既漂亮嫵媚，又倍添誘人魅力。

sentences.english: The temperature there may be 5 times higher in summer as compared to winter.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的溫度夏季可能比冬季高5倍。

sentences.english: That puts the stock on a still-heady multiple of 23 times earnings.
sentences.chinese: 以這一股價折算的雅虎預期市盈率仍然高達23倍。

sentences.english: The fossils in the contents of phosphorus are more than 46 times rock.
sentences.chinese: 化石中的含磷量爲圍巖的46倍以上。

sentences.english: The last 4 times decimation was achieved by two half-band filters and a droop FIR.
sentences.chinese: 剩餘4倍抽取採用兩級半帶濾波器和升幅FIR實現。
手扶拖拉機的產量增長了7倍。

sentences.english: Hybrid fibers can improve impact strength of concrete near 7 times.
sentences.chinese: 混合纖維可以大幅提高混凝土抗衝擊性能近7倍。

sentences.english: That's four times the hospitalisation rate for healthy adults.
sentences.chinese: 這個數字是正常成年人感染後住院率的4倍。

sentences.english: This is the opulence of the twin suites layout… a temple of your supreme status.
sentences.chinese: 豪華雙套房設計，彰顯豪邁氣派，倍添矜貴身價。

sentences.english: Compressed air driven vacuums offer up to 5 times the performance of conventional shop-vacs.
sentences.chinese: 壓縮空氣操作，是普通設備性能的5倍。

sentences.english: There are two hands milk bowl, to the dark night, the artisans of the times.
sentences.chinese: 亦有兩手乳兩鉢，夜至二鼓者，工匠倍之。

definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to double/to increase by a certain number of times
